cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico then accelerating northeast across Florida’s Big Bend into Georgia and the Carolinas before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key/Aucilla River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL northward to South Santee River SC under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning and Hurricane Warning in effect along Florida Gulf Coast from Englewood to Indian Pass including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, southeast Georgia, eastern Carolinas, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions 20–30 mph late Wed night–Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; no surge watch or warning issued for Virginia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Thu as the system passes offshore, which may cause brief localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents beginning Wed night; brief marine restrictions likely for pilotage and container handling operations
